isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - BATTERY, CHARGING & CRANKING SYSTEMS - DESCRIPTION - Cranking Motor Thermal Overcrank Protection

svcproc.title: Cranking Motor Thermal Overcrank Protection
svcproc.para: On vehicles with thermal overcrank protection (optional system), excessive cranking will cause cranking motor temperature to reach a pre-set thermal overcrank limit, and the thermal switch will open causing the motor to dis-engage. This protects the starting motor from heat damage. When the crank motor cools, the switch closes permitting the crank motor to operate again.
